Class PersonRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • PersonRecord

  • public class PersonRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows the user to create and modify a person's record.
    Version:
    1.0 March 4, 2014
    Author:
    Ms. Dyke, Modified by Joshua Yuan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String email
      String reference: Contains the email address of this person.
      private java.lang.String first
      String reference: Contains the first name of this person.
      private java.lang.String last
      String reference: Contains the last name of this person.
      (package private) static int numRecords
      static int: Stores the number of person records created in the address book.
      private java.lang.String phone
      String reference: Contains the phone number of this person.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PersonRecord()
      Empty constructor creates a PersonRecord object without assigning values to any instance variables.
      PersonRecord(java.lang.String first)
      Creates a PersonRecord object with a first name, last name, phone number, and email.

      Creates a PersonRecord object with a first name, last name, phone number, and email.

      Creates a PersonRecord object with a first name, last name, and email.
      PersonRecord(java.lang.String first, java.lang.String last, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String email)
      Creates a PersonRecord object with a first name, last name, phone number, and email.

      • formatPhone

        private java.lang.String formatPhone(java.lang.String phoneToFormat)
        Formats and returns the phone number entered by the user. The first if structure checks if the 10 is the length of the string. The second if structure checks if 12 is the length of the string.
        Parameters:
        phoneToFormat - String reference: Contains the phone number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        String: Returns a string containing a phone number in the format xxx-xxx-xxxx, where x represents a digit.

      • formatName

        private java.lang.String formatName(java.lang.String nameToFormat)
        Formats and returns the first or name last entered by the user. The first if structure checks if the name is one character long. The second if structure checks if the name is two or more characters long.
        Parameters:
        nameToFormat - String reference: Contains the name to be formatted.
        Returns:
        String: Returns a string with the first letter of the name in upper case, and the rest of the name in lower case.
